Get all application roles.name: Get all application roles
Get all application roles.description: Returns all application roles. In Jira, application roles are managed using the Application access configuration page.

Get audit records.name: Get audit records
Get audit records.description: Returns a list of audit records. The list can be filtered to include items:

params.name: offset
params.description: The number of records to skip before returning the first result.

params.name: limit
params.description: The maximum number of results to return. The maximum is 1000.

params.name: filter
params.description: The query string.

params.name: from
params.description: The date and time on or after which returned audit records must have been created. If to is provided from must be before to or no audit records are returned.

params.name: to
params.description: The date and time on or before which returned audit results must have been created. If from is provided to must be after from or no audit records are returned.

Get system avatars by type.name: Get system avatars by type
Get system avatars by type.description: Returns a list of system avatar details by owner type, where the owner types are issue type, project, or user.

Get avatars.name: Get avatars
Get avatars.description: Returns the system and custom avatars for a project or issue type.

Load avatar.name: Load avatar
Load avatar.description: Loads a custom avatar for a project or issue type.

Delete avatar.name: Delete avatar
Delete avatar.description: Deletes an avatar from a project or issue type.

Get all dashboards.name: Get all dashboards
Get all dashboards.description: Returns a list of dashboards owned by or shared with the user. The list may be filtered to include only favorite or owned dashboards.

params.name: filter
params.description: The filter applied to the list of dashboards. Valid values are:

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 1000.

Search for dashboards.name: Search for dashboards
Search for dashboards.description: Searches for dashboards. This operation is similar to Get dashboards except that the results can be refined to include dashboards that have specific attributes. For example, dashboards with a particular name. When multiple attributes are specified only filters matching all attributes are returned.

params.name: dashboardName
params.description: String used to perform a case-insensitive partial match with name.

params.name: accountId
params.description: User account ID used to return dashboards with the matching owner.accountId. This parameter cannot be used with the owner parameter.

params.name: owner
params.description: This parameter is deprecated because of privacy changes. Use accountId instead. See the migration guide for details. User name used to return dashboards with the matching owner.name. This parameter cannot be used with the accountId parameter.

params.name: groupname
params.description: Group name used to returns dashboards that are shared with a group that matches sharePermissions.group.name.

params.name: projectId
params.description: Project ID used to returns dashboards that are shared with a project that matches sharePermissions.project.id.

params.name: orderBy
params.description: Orders the results using one of these dashboard properties:

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 100.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about dashboard in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Get dashboard item property keys.name: Get dashboard item property keys
Get dashboard item property keys.description: Returns the keys of all properties for a dashboard item.

Get dashboard item property.name: Get dashboard item property
Get dashboard item property.description: Returns the key and value of a dashboard item property.

Set dashboard item property.name: Set dashboard item property
Set dashboard item property.description: Sets the value of a dashboard item property. Use this resource in apps to store custom data against a dashboard item.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Create filter.name: Create filter
Create filter.description: Creates a filter. The filter is shared according to the default share scope. The filter is not selected as a favorite.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Create filter.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/filter' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "jql": "type = Bug and resolution is empty",
  "name": "All Open Bugs",
  "description": "Lists all open bugs"
}'

Get favorite filters.name: Get favorite filters
Get favorite filters.description: Returns the visible favorite filters of the user.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Get my filters.name: Get my filters
Get my filters.description: Returns the filters owned by the user. If includeFavourites is true, the user's visible favorite filters are also returned.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

params.name: includeFavourites
params.description: Include the user's favorite filters in the response.

Search for filters.name: Search for filters
Search for filters.description: Searches for filters. This operation is similar to Get filters except that the results can be refined to include filters that have specific attributes. For example, filters with a particular name. When multiple attributes are specified only filters matching all attributes are returned.

params.name: filterName
params.description: String used to perform a case-insensitive partial match with name.

params.name: accountId
params.description: User account ID used to return filters with the matching owner.accountId. This parameter cannot be used with owner.

params.name: owner
params.description: This parameter is deprecated because of privacy changes. Use accountId instead. See the migration guide for details. User name used to return filters with the matching owner.name. This parameter cannot be used with accountId.

params.name: groupname
params.description: Group name used to returns filters that are shared with a group that matches sharePermissions.group.groupname.

params.name: projectId
params.description: Project ID used to returns filters that are shared with a project that matches sharePermissions.project.id.

params.name: orderBy
params.description: Orders the results using one of these filter properties:

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 100.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about filter in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Update filter.name: Update filter
Update filter.description: Updates a filter. Use this operation to update a filter's name, description, JQL, or sharing.
Update filter.command:
curl --request PUT \
  --url '/rest/api/3/filter/{id}' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "jql": "type = Bug and resolution is empty",
  "name": "All Open Bugs",
  "description": "Lists all open bugs"
}'

Get columns.name: Get columns
Get columns.description: Returns the columns configured for a filter. The column configuration is used when the filter's results are viewed in List View with the Columns set to Filter.

Set columns.name: Set columns
Set columns.description: Sets the columns for a filter. Only navigable fields can be set as columns. Use Get fields to get the list fields in Jira. A navigable field has navigable set to true.

Reset columns.name: Reset columns
Reset columns.description: Reset the user's column configuration for the filter to the default.

Add filter as favorite.name: Add filter as favorite
Add filter as favorite.description: Add a filter as a favorite for the user.

Remove filter as favorite.name: Remove filter as favorite
Remove filter as favorite.description: Removes a filter as a favorite for the user. Note that this operation only removes filters visible to the user from the user's favorites list. For example, if the user favorites a public filter that is subsequently made private (and is therefore no longer visible on their favorites list) they cannot remove it from their favorites list.

Get default share scope.name: Get default share scope
Get default share scope.description: Returns the default sharing settings for new filters and dashboards for a user.

Set default share scope.name: Set default share scope
Set default share scope.description: Sets the default sharing for new filters and dashboards for a user.

Get share permissions.name: Get share permissions
Get share permissions.description: Returns the share permissions for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission.

Add share permission.name: Add share permission
Add share permission.description: Add a share permissions to a filter. If you add a global share permission (one for all logged-in users or the public) it will overwrite all share permissions for the filter.

Get share permission.name: Get share permission
Get share permission.description: Returns a share permission for a filter. A filter can be shared with groups, projects, all logged-in users, or the public. Sharing with all logged-in users or the public is known as a global share permission.

Delete share permission.name: Delete share permission
Delete share permission.description: Deletes a share permission from a filter.

Find users and groups.name: Find users and groups
Find users and groups.description: Returns a list of users and groups matching a string. The string is used:

params.name: query
params.description: The search string.

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return in each list. The maximum is 1000.

params.name: showAvatar
params.description: Indicates whether the user avatar should be returned. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

params.name: fieldId
params.description: The custom field ID of the field this request is for.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of a project that returned users and groups must have permission to view. To include multiple projects, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, projectId=10000&projectId=10001. This parameter is only used when fieldId is present.

params.name: issueTypeId
params.description: The ID of an issue type that returned users and groups must have permission to view. To include multiple issue types, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, issueTypeId=10000&issueTypeId=10001. Special values, such as -1 (all standard issue types) and -2 (all subtask issue types), are supported. This parameter is only used when fieldId is present.

params.name: avatarSize
params.description: The size of the avatar to return. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

params.name: caseInsensitive
params.description: Indicates whether the search for groups should be case insensitive.

params.name: excludeConnectAddons
params.description: Indicates whether Connect app users and groups should be excluded from the search results. If an invalid value is provided, the default value is used.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: expand
params.description: List of fields to expand.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: swapGroup
params.description: The group to transfer restrictions to. Only comments and worklogs are transferred. If restrictions are not transferred, comments and worklogs are inaccessible after the deletion.

Get users from group.name: Get users from group
Get users from group.description: Returns all users in a group. Users are ordered by username.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: includeInactiveUsers
params.description: Include inactive users.

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 50.

Add user to group.name: Add user to group
Add user to group.description: Adds a user to a group.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group (case sensitive).

Remove user from group.name: Remove user from group
Remove user from group.description: Removes a user from a group.

params.name: groupname
params.description: The name of the group.

params.name: username
params.description: This parameter is deprecated because of privacy changes. Use accountId instead. See the migration guide for details.

params.name: accountId
params.description: The accountId of the user, which uniquely identifies the user across all Atlassian products. For example, 384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192. Required, unless username is specified.

Find groups.name: Find groups
Find groups.description: Returns a list of groups whose names contain a query string. A list of group names can be provided to exclude groups from the results.

params.name: accountId
params.description: This parameter is deprecated, setting it does not affect the results. To find groups containing a particular user, use Get user groups.

params.name: query
params.description: The string to find in group names.

params.name: exclude
params.description: A group to exclude from the result. To exclude multiple groups, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, exclude=group1&exclude=group2.

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of groups to return. The maximum number of groups that can be returned is limited by the system property jira.ajax.autocomplete.limit.

params.name: userName
params.description: This parameter is deprecated, setting it does not affect the results. To find groups containing a particular user, use Get user groups.

Create issue.name: Create issue
Create issue.description: Creates an issue or, where the option to create subtasks is enabled in Jira, a subtask. A transition may be applied, to move the issue or subtask to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

params.name: updateHistory
params.description: Indicates whether the project in which the issue is created is added to the user's Recently viewed project list, as shown under Projects in Jira.

Bulk create issue.name: Bulk create issue
Bulk create issue.description: Creates issues and, where the option to create subtasks is enabled in Jira, subtasks. Transitions may be applied, to move the issues or subtasks to a workflow step other than the default start step, and issue properties set.

Get create issue metadata.name: Get create issue metadata
Get create issue metadata.description: Returns details of projects, issue types within projects, and, when requested, the create screen fields for each issue type for the user. Use the information to populate the requests in  Create issue and Create issues.

params.name: projectIds
params.description: Comma-separated list of project IDs. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, projectIds=10000,10001&projectIds=10020,10021. This parameter may be provided with projectKeys.

params.name: projectKeys
params.description: Comma-separated list of project keys. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, projectKeys=proj1,proj2&projectKeys=proj3. This parameter may be provided with projectIds.

params.name: issuetypeIds
params.description: Comma-separated list of issue type IDs. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, issuetypeIds=10000,10001&issuetypeIds=10020,10021. This parameter may be provided with issuetypeNames.

params.name: issuetypeNames
params.description: Comma-separated list of issue type names. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, issuetypeNames=name1,name2&issuetypeNames=name3. This parameter may be provided with issuetypeIds.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about issue metadata in the response. This parameter accepts projects.issuetypes.fields which returns information about the fields in the issue creation screen for each issue type. Fields hidden from the screen are not returned. Use the information to populate the fields and update fields in Create issue and Create issues.

Get issue.name: Get issue
Get issue.description: Returns the details for an issue.

Edit issue.name: Edit issue
Edit issue.description: Edits an issue. A transition may be applied and issue properties updated as part of the edit.

Assign issue.name: Assign issue
Assign issue.description: Assigns an issue to a user. Use this operation when the calling user does not have the Edit Issues permission but has the Assign issue permission for the project that the issue is in.

Get change logs.name: Get change logs
Get change logs.description: Returns all changelogs for an issue sorted by date, starting from the oldest.

Get edit issue metadata.name: Get edit issue metadata
Get edit issue metadata.description: Returns the edit screen fields for an issue that are visible to and editable by the user. Use the information to populate the requests in Edit issue.

Send notification for issue.name: Send notification for issue
Send notification for issue.description: Creates an email notification for an issue and adds it to the mail queue.

Get transitions.name: Get transitions
Get transitions.description: Returns either all transitions or a transition that can be performed by the user on an issue, based on the issue's status.

Transition issue.name: Transition issue
Transition issue.description: Performs an issue transition and, if the transition has a screen, updates the fields from the transition screen.

Get Jira attachment settings.name: Get Jira attachment settings
Get Jira attachment settings.description: Returns the attachment settings, that is, whether attachments are enabled and the maximum attachment size allowed.

Get attachment metadata.name: Get attachment metadata
Get attachment metadata.description: Returns the metadata for an attachment. Note that the attachment itself is not returned.

Delete attachment.name: Delete attachment
Delete attachment.description: Deletes an attachment from an issue.

Get all metadata for an expanded attachm.name: Get all metadata for an expanded attachment

Get contents metadata for an expanded at.name: Get contents metadata for an expanded attachment

Add attachment.name: Add attachment
Add attachment.description: Adds one or more attachments to an issue. Attachments are posted as multipart/form-data (RFC 1867).

Get comments by IDs.name: Get comments by IDs
Get comments by IDs.description: Returns the comments for a list of comment IDs.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about comments in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Get comments.name: Get comments
Get comments.description: Returns all comments for an issue.

Add comment.name: Add comment
Add comment.description: Adds a comment to an issue.

Update comment.name: Update comment

Get comment property keys.name: Get comment property keys
Get comment property keys.description: Returns the keys of all the properties of a comment.

Get comment property.name: Get comment property
Get comment property.description: Returns the value of a comment property.

Set comment property.name: Set comment property
Set comment property.description: Creates or updates the value of a property for a comment. Use this resource to store custom data against a comment.

Get custom field option.name: Get custom field option
Get custom field option.description: Returns a custom field option. For example, an option in a cascading select list.

Get fields.name: Get fields
Get fields.description: Returns system and custom issue fields according to the following rules:

Create custom field.name: Create custom field
Create custom field.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/field' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "searcherKey": "com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppickersearcher",
  "name": "New custom field",
  "description": "Custom field for picking groups",
  "type": "com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:grouppicker"
}'

Get all issue field options.name: Get all issue field options
Get all issue field options.description: Returns all options defined for a select list issue field. A select list issue field is a type of issue field that allows a user to select n value from a list of options.

Create issue field option.name: Create issue field option
Create issue field option.description: Creates an option for a select list issue field.

Get selectable issue field options.name: Get selectable issue field options
Get selectable issue field options.description: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed and selected by the user.

Get visible issue field options.name: Get visible issue field options
Get visible issue field options.description: Returns options defined for a select list issue field that can be viewed by the user.

Get issue field option.name: Get issue field option
Get issue field option.description: Returns an option from a select list issue field.

Update issue field option.name: Update issue field option
Update issue field option.description: Updates or creates an option for a select list issue field. This operation requires that the option ID is provided when creating an option, therefore, the option ID needs to be specified as a path and body parameter. The option ID provided in the path and body must be identical.

Delete issue field option.name: Delete issue field option
Delete issue field option.description: Deletes an option from a select list issue field.

Replace issue field option.name: Replace issue field option
Replace issue field option.description: Deselects an issue-field select-list option from all issues where it is selected. A different option can be selected to replace the deselected option. The update can also be limited to a smaller set of issues by using a JQL query.

Create issue link.name: Create issue link
Create issue link.description: Creates a link between two issues. Use this operation to indicate a relationship between two issues and optionally add a comment to the from (outward) issue. To use this resource the site must have Issue Linking enabled.

Get issue link types.name: Get issue link types
Get issue link types.description: Returns a list of all issue link types.

Create issue link type.name: Create issue link type
Create issue link type.description: Creates an issue link type. Use this operation to create descriptions of the reasons why issues are linked. The issue link type consists of a name and descriptions for a link's inward and outward relationships.
Create issue link type.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/issueLinkType' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "inward": "Duplicated by",
  "name": "Duplicate",
  "outward": "Duplicates"
}'

Get issue navigator default columns.name: Get issue navigator default columns
Get issue navigator default columns.description: Returns the default issue navigator columns.

Set issue navigator default columns.name: Set issue navigator default columns
Set issue navigator default columns.description: Sets the default issue navigator columns.

Get notification schemes paginated.name: Get notification schemes paginated
Get notification schemes paginated.description: Returns a paginated list of notification schemes in order by display name.

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 50.

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

Get notification scheme.name: Get notification scheme
Get notification scheme.description: Returns a notification scheme, including the list of events and the recipients who will receive notifications for those events.

Get priorities.name: Get priorities
Get priorities.description: Returns the list of all issue priorities.

Get issue property keys.name: Get issue property keys
Get issue property keys.description: Returns the URLs and keys of an issue's properties.

Get issue property.name: Get issue property
Get issue property.description: Returns the key and value of an issue's property.

Set issue property.name: Set issue property
Set issue property.description: Sets the value of an issue's property. Use this resource to store custom data against an issue.

Get remote issue links.name: Get remote issue links
Get remote issue links.description: Returns the remote issue links for an issue. When a remote issue link global ID is provided the record with that global ID is returned, otherwise all remote issue links are returned.

Create or update remote issue link.name: Create or update remote issue link
Create or update remote issue link.description: Creates or updates a remote issue link for an issue.

Delete remote issue link by global id.name: Delete remote issue link by global id
Delete remote issue link by global id.description: Deletes the remote issue link from the issue using the link's global ID.

Get remote issue link by id.name: Get remote issue link by id
Get remote issue link by id.description: Returns a remote issue link for an issue.

Update remote issue link.name: Update remote issue link
Update remote issue link.description: Updates a remote issue link for an issue.

Delete remote issue link by id.name: Delete remote issue link by id
Delete remote issue link by id.description: Deletes a remote issue link from an issue.

Get resolutions.name: Get resolutions
Get resolutions.description: Returns a list of all issue resolution values.

Get issue picker suggestions.name: Get issue picker suggestions
Get issue picker suggestions.description: Returns lists of issues matching a query string. Use this resource to provide auto-completion suggestions when the user is looking for an issue using a word or string.

params.name: query
params.description: A string to match against text fields in the issue such as title, description, or comments.

params.name: currentJQL
params.description: A JQL query defining a list of issues to search for the query term. Note that username and userkey have been deprecated as search terms for this parameter. See the  migration guide for details. Use accountId instead.

params.name: currentIssueKey
params.description: The key of an issue to exclude from search results. For example, the issue the user is viewing when they perform this query.

params.name: currentProjectId
params.description: The ID of a project that suggested issues must belong to.

params.name: showSubTasks
params.description: Indicate whether to include subtasks in the suggestions list.

params.name: showSubTaskParent
params.description: When currentIssueKey is a subtask, indicates whether to include the parent issue in the suggestions if it matches the query.

Check issues against JQL.name: Check issues against JQL
Check issues against JQL.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/jql/match' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "issueIds": [
    10001,
    1000,
    10042
  ],
  "jqls": [
    "project = FOO",
    "issuetype = Bug",
    "summary ~ \"some text\" AND project in (FOO, BAR)"
  ]
}'

params.name: jql
params.description: The JQL that defines the search. If no JQL expression is provided, all issues are returned. Note that username and userkey have been deprecated as search terms for this parameter. See the migration guide for details. Use accountId instead.

params.name: startAt
params.description: The index of the first item to return in a page of results (page offset).

params.name: maxResults
params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

params.name: validateQuery
params.description: Determines how to validate the JQL query and treat the validation results. Supported values are:

params.name: fields
params.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return for each issue, use it to retrieve a subset of fields. Allowed values:

params.name: expand
params.description: Use expand to include additional information about issues in the response. This parameter accepts multiple values separated by a comma:

params.name: properties
params.description: A comma-separated list of issue property keys for issue properties to include in the results. This parameter may be specified multiple times. For example, properties=prop1,prop2&properties=prop3. A maximum of 5 issue property keys can be specified.

params.name: fieldsByKeys
params.description: Reference fields by their key (rather than ID).

Search for issues using JQL (POST).name: Search for issues using JQL (POST)
Search for issues using JQL (POST).command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/search' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "expand": [
    "names",
    "schema",
    "operations"
  ],
  "jql": "project = HSP",
  "maxResults": 15,
  "fieldsByKeys": false,
  "fields": [
    "summary",
    "status",
    "assignee"
  ],
  "startAt": 0
}'

Get issue security level.name: Get issue security level
Get issue security level.description: Returns details of an issue security level.

Get issue security scheme.name: Get issue security scheme
Get issue security scheme.description: Returns an issue security scheme along with its security levels.

Get all issue types for user.name: Get all issue types for user

Create issue type.name: Create issue type
Create issue type.description: Creates an issue type and adds it to the default issue type scheme.

Delete issue type.name: Delete issue type
Delete issue type.description: Deletes the issue type. If the issue type is in use, all uses are updated with the alternative issue type (alternativeIssueTypeId). A list of alternative issue types are obtained from the Get alternative issue types resource.

Get alternative issue types.name: Get alternative issue types
Get alternative issue types.description: Returns a list of issue types that can be used to replace the issue type. The alternative issue types are those assigned to the same workflow scheme, field configuration scheme, and screen scheme.

Load issue type avatar.name: Load issue type avatar
Load issue type avatar.description: Loads an avatar for the issue type.

Get issue type property keys.name: Get issue type property keys
Get issue type property keys.description: Returns all the issue type property keys of the issue type.

Get issue type property.name: Get issue type property
Get issue type property.description: Returns the key and value of the issue type property.

Set issue type property.name: Set issue type property
Set issue type property.description: Creates or updates the value of the issue type property. Use this resource to store and update data against an issue type.

Get votes.name: Get votes
Get votes.description: Returns details about the votes on an issue.

Add vote.name: Add vote
Add vote.description: Adds the user's vote to an issue. This is the equivalent of the user clicking Vote on an issue in Jira.

Delete vote.name: Delete vote
Delete vote.description: Deletes a user's vote from an issue. This is the equivalent of the user clicking Unvote on an issue in Jira.

Get issue watchers.name: Get issue watchers
Get issue watchers.description: Returns the watchers for an issue.

Add watcher.name: Add watcher
Add watcher.description: Adds a user as a watcher of an issue by passing the account ID or name of the user as a JSON string. For example, "384093:32b4d9w0-f6a5-3535-11a3-9c8c88d10192". The use of name is deprecated because of privacy changes. Use account ID instead. See the migration guide for details. If no user is specified the calling user is added.

Delete watcher.name: Delete watcher
Delete watcher.description: Deletes a user as a watcher of an issue.

Get issue worklogs.name: Get issue worklogs

For example, you can change the value of the jira.clone.prefix from its default value of CLONE - to Clone - if you prefer sentence case capitalization. Editable properties are described below along with their default values.

Get global settings.description: Returns the global settings in Jira. These settings determine whether optional features (for example, subtasks, time tracking, and others) are enabled. If time tracking is enabled, this operation also returns the time tracking configuration.

Get field reference data.description: Returns reference data for JQL searches. This is a downloadable version of the documentation provided in Advanced searching - fields reference and Advanced searching - functions reference, along with a list of JQL-reserved words. Use this information to assist with the programmatic creation of JQL queries or the validation of queries built in a custom query builder.

params.name: predicateName
params.description: The name of the  CHANGED operator predicate for which the suggestions are generated. The valid predicate operators are by, from, and to.

params.name: predicateValue
params.description: The partial predicate item name entered by the user.

Convert user identifiers to account IDs.command:
curl --request POST \
  --url '/rest/api/3/jql/pdcleaner' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json' \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --data '{
  "queryStrings": [
    "assignee = mia",
    "issuetype = Bug AND assignee in (mia) AND reporter in (alana) order by lastViewed DESC"
  ]
}'

}'

Delete default actors from project role.description: Deletes the default actors from a project role. You may delete a group or user, but you cannot delete a group and a user in the same request.

Find users assignable to projects.description: Returns a list of users who can be assigned issues in one or more projects. The list may be restricted to users whose attributes match a string.

params.name: query
params.description: A query string that is matched against user attributes, such as key, name, displayName, and emailAddress, to find relevant users. The string can match any part of the attribute's value. For example, query=john matches a user with a displayName of John Smith and a user with an emailAddress of jane.johnson@example.com.

params.description: This parameter is deprecated because of privacy changes. Use query instead. See the migration guide for details. A query string used to search username, display name, and email address. The string is matched to the starting letters of any word in the searched fields. For example, ar matches to the username archie but not mark.

params.description: The maximum number of items to return per page. The maximum is 1000.

Create workflow scheme.name: Create workflow scheme

Update workflow scheme.name: Update workflow scheme
Update workflow scheme.description: Updates a workflow scheme, including the name, default workflow, issue type to project mappings, and more. If the workflow scheme is active (that is, being used by at least one project), then a draft workflow scheme is created or updated instead, provided that updateDraftIfNeeded is set to true.

Delete workflow scheme.name: Delete workflow scheme
Delete workflow scheme.description: Deletes a workflow scheme. Note that a workflow scheme cannot be deleted if it is active (that is, being used by at least one project).

Get default workflow.name: Get default workflow
Get default workflow.description: Returns the default workflow for a workflow scheme. The default workflow is the workflow that is assigned any issue types that have not been mapped to any other workflow. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types listed in its issue types for the workflow scheme in Jira.

Update default workflow.name: Update default workflow
Update default workflow.description: Sets the default workflow for a workflow scheme.

Delete default workflow.name: Delete default workflow
Delete default workflow.description: Resets the default workflow for a workflow scheme. That is, the default workflow is set to Jira's system workflow (the jira workflow).

Get workflow for issue type in workflow.name: Get workflow for issue type in workflow scheme
Get workflow for issue type in workflow.description: Returns the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme.

Set workflow for issue type in workflow.name: Set workflow for issue type in workflow scheme
Set workflow for issue type in workflow.description: Sets the workflow for an issue type in a workflow scheme.

Delete workflow for issue type in workfl.name: Delete workflow for issue type in workflow scheme
Delete workflow for issue type in workfl.description: Deletes the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme.

Get issue types for workflows in workflo.name: Get issue types for workflows in workflow scheme
Get issue types for workflows in workflo.description: Returns the workflow-issue type mappings for a workflow scheme.

Set issue types for workflow in workflow.name: Set issue types for workflow in workflow scheme
Set issue types for workflow in workflow.description: Sets the issue types for a workflow in a workflow scheme's draft. The workflow can also be set as the default workflow for the draft workflow scheme. Unmapped issues types are mapped to the default workflow.

Delete issue types for workflow in workf.name: Delete issue types for workflow in workflow scheme
Delete issue types for workflow in workf.description: Deletes the workflow-issue type mapping for a workflow in a workflow scheme.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of a project to return the workflow schemes for. To include multiple projects, provide multiple copies of this parameter. For example, projectId=10000&projectId=10001.

Create draft workflow scheme.name: Create draft workflow scheme
Create draft workflow scheme.description: Create a draft workflow scheme from an active workflow scheme, by copying the active workflow scheme. Note that an active workflow scheme can only have one draft workflow scheme.

Get draft workflow scheme.name: Get draft workflow scheme
Get draft workflow scheme.description: Returns the draft workflow scheme for an active workflow scheme. Draft workflow schemes allow changes to be made to the active workflow schemes: When an active workflow scheme is updated, a draft copy is created. The draft is modified, then the changes in the draft are copied back to the active workflow scheme. See Configuring workflow schemes for more information.Note that:

Update draft workflow scheme.name: Update draft workflow scheme
Update draft workflow scheme.description: Updates a draft workflow scheme. If a draft workflow scheme does not exist for the active workflow scheme, then a draft is created. Note that an active workflow scheme can only have one draft workflow scheme.

Get draft default workflow.name: Get draft default workflow
Get draft default workflow.description: Returns the default workflow for a workflow scheme's draft. The default workflow is the workflow that is assigned any issue types that have not been mapped to any other workflow. The default workflow has All Unassigned Issue Types listed in its issue types for the workflow scheme in Jira.

Update draft default workflow.name: Update draft default workflow
Update draft default workflow.description: Sets the default workflow for a workflow scheme's draft.

Delete draft default workflow.name: Delete draft default workflow
Delete draft default workflow.description: Resets the default workflow for a workflow scheme's draft. That is, the default workflow is set to Jira's system workflow (the jira workflow).

Get workflow for issue type in draft wor.name: Get workflow for issue type in draft workflow scheme
Get workflow for issue type in draft wor.description: Returns the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme's draft.

Set workflow for issue type in draft wor.name: Set workflow for issue type in draft workflow scheme
Set workflow for issue type in draft wor.description: Sets the workflow for an issue type in a workflow scheme's draft.

Delete workflow for issue type in draft.name: Delete workflow for issue type in draft workflow scheme
Delete workflow for issue type in draft.description: Deletes the issue type-workflow mapping for an issue type in a workflow scheme's draft.

Get issue types for workflows in draft w.name: Get issue types for workflows in draft workflow scheme
Get issue types for workflows in draft w.description: Returns the workflow-issue type mappings for a workflow scheme's draft.

Delete issue types for workflow in draft.name: Delete issue types for workflow in draft workflow scheme
Delete issue types for workflow in draft.description: Deletes the workflow-issue type mapping for a workflow in a workflow scheme's draft.

Get all statuses.name: Get all statuses
Get all statuses.description: Returns a list of all statuses associated with workflows.

Get status.name: Get status
Get status.description: Returns a status. The status must be associated with a workflow to be returned.

Get all status categories.name: Get all status categories
Get all status categories.description: Returns a list of all status categories.

Get status category.name: Get status category
Get status category.description: Returns a status category. Status categories provided a mechanism for categorizing statuses.

Get workflow transition properties.name: Get workflow transition properties
Get workflow transition properties.description: Returns the properties on a workflow transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.

Update workflow transition property.name: Update workflow transition property
Update workflow transition property.description: Updates a workflow transition by changing the property value. Trying to update a property that does not exist results in a new property being added to the transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.

Create workflow transition property.name: Create workflow transition property
Create workflow transition property.description: Adds a property to a workflow transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.

Delete workflow transition property.name: Delete workflow transition property
Delete workflow transition property.description: Deletes a property from a workflow transition. Transition properties are used to change the behavior of a transition. For more information, see Transition properties and Workflow properties.
